resources.name: Los Angeles Mission
resources.description: Faith-based organization providing emergency shelter, food assistance, recovery programs, and comprehensive reentry services for individuals overcoming homelessness, addiction, and incarceration. Partners with LA Regional Food Bank to serve formerly incarcerated individuals.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to individuals experiencing homelessness, addiction, and those in reentry from incarceration. Faith-based programming is part of residential programs.
resources.fees: Free emergency services, residential programs available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Los Angeles food bank reentry services'

resources.name: Sober Living Network
resources.description: Nonprofit organization promoting excellence in sober living and community recovery support resources. Provides information, referral, best practice standards, training, and support for approximately 500 residential recovery environments across Southern California.
services_offered: Sober living housing information and referral
Best practice standards for recovery housing
Quality assurance for sober living facilities
resources.eligibility_requirements: Information and referral services available for individuals seeking sober living housing in Los Angeles, Orange, Riverside, San Bernardino, and Ventura Counties. Each individual sober living home has its own eligibility requirements.
resources.fees: Free information and referral services. Individual sober living homes charge rent.
accessibility_features: Referrals to 500+ recovery homes across Southern California
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Sober Living Network Los Angeles recovery housing'

resources.name: U.S. VETS - Los Angeles (Inglewood)
resources.description: Provides employment, workforce programs, and transitional and permanent housing services for veterans. One-stop veteran service center offering clinical counseling and employment assistance coordinated with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.
resources.eligibility_requirements: U.S. military veterans, including those in reentry from incarceration. Services for returning veterans and their families.
resources.fees: Services based on program eligibility and VA benefits
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'U.S. VETS Los Angeles veterans reentry'

resources.name: Union Rescue Mission
resources.description: Largest private homeless shelter in the United States, providing comprehensive Christian-based recovery programs, emergency shelter, transitional housing, education, job training, and family services to help people rebuild their lives.
services_offered: Residential transitional living and recovery program
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness, including those in recovery and reentry. Christian faith-based programming is central to residential programs.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Union Rescue Mission Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: The Midnight Mission
resources.description: Providing continuous service since 1914, offering food, 12-step drug and alcohol recovery services, safe sleep programs, educational training, mobile kitchen, family housing, job training, and workforce development to help individuals and families achieve self-sufficiency.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness, addiction, and those in reentry. Open to all who need services.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Midnight Mission Los Angeles reentry recovery'

resources.name: SHIELDS for Families
resources.description: Community-based nonprofit in South Los Angeles providing comprehensive social services including substance abuse treatment, mental health services, housing, legal services, and vocational training. Serves those on probation, parole, supervised release, reentry, and drug court.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Serves individuals with open DCFS cases, on probation or parole, on supervised release/reentry, and drug court participants. Priority for South Los Angeles residents.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'SHIELDS for Families Los Angeles reentry'

resources.name: Goodwill Southern California - WorkSource Centers
resources.description: Provides no-cost career counseling, resume workshops, interview coaching, job search tools, and referrals to education courses. Assists veterans, at-risk youth, homeless individuals, formerly incarcerated individuals, and those with disabilities and greatest barriers to employment.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers, with priority for veterans, at-risk youth, homeless individuals, formerly incarcerated individuals (ex-offenders), and those with significant disabilities and greatest barriers to employment.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Goodwill Southern California employment reentry'

resources.name: PATH (People Assisting The Homeless)
resources.description: Provides transitional housing, support services, and assistance for getting into permanent housing for homeless individuals and families. Offers interim housing, employment assistance, case management, and comprehensive support for transitioning to stability.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness. Special services for veterans available.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'PATH People Assisting The Homeless Los Angeles'

resources.name: Covenant House California
resources.description: Youth shelter providing sanctuary and support for homeless youth ages 18-24. Offers 90-day dormitory-style shelter, transitional living program, medical and mental health clinic, day and street outreach, community center, and education/employment skills programs.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth experiencing homelessness, ages 18-24. Services also available for youth involved in justice system and those aging out of foster care.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Covenant House California Los Angeles youth reentry'

resources.name: Downtown Women's Center
resources.description: Only organization in Los Angeles focused exclusively on serving and empowering women experiencing homelessness and formerly homeless women. Provides health and wellness services, counseling, medical care, mental health services, and job readiness and employment training.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Women experiencing homelessness and formerly homeless women. Services exclusively for women.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Downtown Women's Center Los Angeles'

resources.name: Skid Row Housing Trust
resources.description: Provides permanent supportive housing for people who have experienced homelessness, prolonged extreme poverty, poor health, disabilities, mental illness and/or addiction. Operates 26 buildings across LA County with nearly 2,000 residents.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals who have experienced homelessness, prolonged extreme poverty, poor health, disabilities, mental illness, and/or addiction. Must apply through their application process.
resources.fees: Affordable rent based on 30% of income for eligible residents
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Skid Row Housing Trust Los Angeles permanent supportive housing'

resources.name: Social Model Recovery Systems
resources.description: Provides residential substance abuse treatment for adults 18+ at multiple locations throughout Los Angeles County. Offers comprehensive recovery services in a supportive community environment with 24-hour staffing.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adults 18+ with substance use disorders. Males and females served at separate facilities. Available through LA County Substance Abuse Service Helpline (SASH) at 1-844-804-7500.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Social Model Recovery Systems Los Angeles substance abuse reentry'

notes: Third research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Focus on faith-based organizations, veterans services, youth programs, women's services, housing, and food assistance. All contact information verified from organization websites and official sources.
